p: In patients with heart diseases, the level of plasma ACE2 is high [ 33] but unable to provide protection against COVID-19 [ 5]. This suggests that ACE2 is important for SARS-CoV-2 cell entry but that its expression levels do not correlate with the degree of infection and viral load [ 34]. The equilibrium between soluble and membrane-bound ACE2 should also be analyzed as it might influence the COVID-19 pathogenesis [ 33].
